page.title: 11Three Horshoes Inn
page.content: The Inn is at the eastern end of Norton opposite the school. It has been there for 300 years, but the present building for only 100 years. For many years the licencee was a member of a Norton family, the Chamberlains.The last member of the family gave up the tenancy in the early days of the Garden City and passed it to Simpsons the brewers who rented it from Mr Morris Pryor the landowner.An interesting fact is that the Inn contained for many years a Dames School paid for by a certain Mr Edward Wright in 1830.This remained open until 1872. The last mistress was Elizabeth Chamberlain. The Inn today is in the hands of Charrington brewery and still sells food, drink and offers some accomodation.
